title: Why scalar field is indispensable in Teleparallel Gravity theory?
authors: Dalia Saha, Jyoti Prasad Saha, Abhik kumar sanyal
abstract:
Teleparallel gravity theories were proposed as alternatives to the dark
energy and modified theories of gravity. However, both the metric and symmetric
teleparallel gravity theories have been found to have serious pathologies, such
as coupling issues and Ostrogradski's instability leading to ghost degrees of
freedom. In this article we explore the fact that the theories are at-least
free from the issue of `Branched Hamiltonian' though, nonetheless, early
inflation as well as a viable radiation era may only be driven by a scalar
field.
